DesignDescription: Paired-end RNA-seq library of ployadenylated mRNA isolate from pooled L4 stage Ascaris suum isolated from the small intestine of experimentally infected pigs (Sus scofra)
Illumina sequencing of De novo nematode genome sequencing project to sequence, Ascaris suum, or Pig Roundworm 2887699733 fragment RNA-Seq library

Total RNA was extracted from pooled embryonic and juvenile stages and shipped to GeneCore (EMBL Genomics Core Facilities, Heidelberg, Germany) for library construction and sequencing. A cDNA library was prepared with the Illumina TruSeq RNA Sample Prep Kit v2 using oligo-dT purification to select mRNA. The library was sequenced on a full lane of an Illumina HiSeq 2000.
Illumina sequencing of Ascaris lumbricoides Genome sequencing 2892770808 fragment WGS library

RNA was extracted from pooled samples of Anisaksi simplex (n= 134) using the Trizol reagent (Invitrogen™, Life Technologies, Carlsbad, USA), and DNase-treated using Turbo DNA-free™ (Ambion™, Austin, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The amounts and integrity of total RNA were determined using a 2100 BioAnalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, California, USA). Polyadenylated (PolyA+) RNA was purified from 10 mg of total RNA from Anisakis simplex pool using Sera-Mag oligo(dT) beads, fragmented to a length of 100–500 nucleotides and reverse transcribed to cDNA using random hexamers. The size-fractionated cDNA was end-repaired and adaptor-ligated according to the manufacturer’s protocol (Illumina). Ligated products of 200 bp were excised from agarose gels and PCR-amplified (15 cycles). Products were cleaned using a MinElute PCR purification kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) and paired-end sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 2000 according to the manufacturer’s protocol.
7 day embryos (popluation), 400ng loading, 3 PCR                 circle
RNA-seq of the nematode Ascaridia galli exposed to flubendazole against untreated control

For transcriptome sequencing on an Illumina platform a TruSeq RNA library generation was utilized. The library was generated by using the TruSeq RNA Sample Prep Kit v2 (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA) following the manufacturers instructions. The library was quantified by using the KAPA Library Quantification Kit for Illumina (Kapa Biosystems, Wilmington, MA, USA). The library size was determined by using the High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit for the 2100 Bioanalyzer Instrument (Agilent Technologies, Waldbronn, Germany). Libraries were adjusted to a concentration of 12 pM and sequenced on a HiSeq 1500 instrument (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA) in high-output mode. For cluster generation, the TruSeq PE Cluster Kit v3 was used. Cluster generation was performed on a cBot instrument. For sequencing the TruSeq SBS Kit v3 was used to sequence 100 + 100 bases.

WGS Illumina Sequencing of mature whole worm of Ascaris ovis for assembling mitochondrion genome

113 L3 individuals larvae of anisakid nematodes obtained from fish captured along the FAO 27 area were studied. Bacteria were taxonomically characterized through 1803 representative OTUsequences. Fourteen Phyla, 31 Classes, 52 Orders, 129 Families and 187 genera were unambiguously identified. Association or relationship among bacteria in Anisakids, exists without the influence of fishes or nematode species.

60h embryos irradiated with 200Gy X-ray followed by 0h recovery time. Embryo membrane was disrupted by 5x strokes in a metal dounce. DNA was isolated following Qiagen Genomic DNA Handbook, following the cultured cells protocol. Qiagen genomic tips 20/G were used to isolate genomic DNA. Libraries were prepared with Illumina Nextera Library Preperation Kit

Genomic DNA was extracted from small tissue of adult Trichuris trichiura worm. The concentration and purity of genomic DNA was quantified using Nanodrop Spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific; 2000). Library preparation was performed using QIASeq FX DNA Library Preparation protocol(Cat#180475) by following manufacturers instructions. The amplified library was purified using Cambrian Bioworks CamSelect NGS(#CBWD010) followed by library quality control check.
